result.execSummary:
The defendant Tabitha R Zimmerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to comply with any dispositional orders in the CHIPS case.
-DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tabitha R Zimmerman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Per Agent Deb Duel - defendant has paid all financial obligations.  No PRH needed.
43

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
1:38 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson/Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea with probation.  State concurs.  Atty Selsing concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Selsing.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to comply with any dispositional orders in the CHIPS case.
-DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 1:45 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:15 P.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - an agreement has been reached.  Court sets for Plea & sentencing on May 3, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:16 p.m.

11:35 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - have not received Discovery and requests a status.  Court sets for Status Hearing on March 15, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 11:36 a.m.

1:57 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - met with the defendant today and will be setting up a pretrial with the DA.  Court sets for Status Hearing on February 9, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:58 p.m.

Per Deb at the Public Defender's office, the defendant qualifies for PD representation and will be apppointing counsel.  Deb will contact the defendant to inform her that she does not need to appear pm 11/17.
43

ADDRESS INFO for Tabitha R Zimmerman - per defendant
Current: W865 Prairie Drive, Markesan, WI 53946 United States  (Effective: 11-03-2015)
Prior: W934 Cty Rd Aw, Markesan, WI 53946
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:58 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 17, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:00 a.m.
